titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1639
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1639

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

1.[…] Saʿdum M[.]fikān and [their] sons ʾA- 2.bīkarib have dedicated to ʾĪlmuqu[hū, Lord of 3.the Ibexes of Ṣirwāḥ, a statue of bronze be- 4.[cause] he had granted him to be justified over Thawābtha- 5.[wā]n bin Murādum, client of the lineage of 6.Dhū-Ḥubāb, against the accusation and the charge 7.which they (i.e. the lineage of Dhū-Ḥubāb) had levelled against his son 8.ʾAbīkarib, (and against the charge) that he had disengaged from his (Thawābthawān‘s) son ʿAbdʿath- 9.tar on the road with deceit(?). And behold that ʾĪlmuquh had grant- 10.ed him (i.e. the main dedicant of the inscription) the restoration of legal right for ʾAbīkarib. 11.And behold that they expressed gratitude to the power and might of ʾĪ- 12.lmuqu<h>ū when he restored to his servants their legal right, 13.as he had vouchsafed to them in 14.his oracle that he secured the protection of 15.his son because he did not refrain from 16.importuning him (with prayers) and requests for oracles from him 17.regarding all (his affairs) that might be contested. And behold that 18.his lord ʾĪlmuquhū had promised him 19.the [pro]tection of his servants from [his] wrath. 20.And behold that Sharaḥʿathat 21.and ʾAbīkarib have dedicated to their lord ʾĪlmuquh[ū] 22.a statue fort he protection of their persons 23.[and] their livestock. By ʾĪlmuquhū and 24.their protective [goddess].

div.tei:ab:
… Saʿdum M.fikān and their sons ʾA-
bīkarib have dedicated to ʾĪlmuquhū, Lord of
the Ibexes of Ṣirwāḥ, a statue of bronze be-
cause he had granted him to be justified over Thawābtha-
wān bin Murādum, client of the lineage of
Dhū-Ḥubāb, against the accusation and the charge
which they i.e. the lineage of Dhū-Ḥubāb had levelled against his son
ʾAbīkarib, and against the charge that he had disengaged from his Thawābthawān‘s son ʿAbdʿath-
tar on the road with deceit?. And behold that ʾĪlmuquh had grant-
ed him i.e. the main dedicant of the inscription the restoration of legal right for ʾAbīkarib.
And behold that they expressed gratitude to the power and might of ʾĪ-
lmuquhū when he restored to his servants their legal right,
as he had vouchsafed to them in
his oracle that he secured the protection of
his son because he did not refrain from
importuning him with prayers and requests for oracles from him
regarding all his affairs that might be contested. And behold that
his lord ʾĪlmuquhū had promised him
the protection of his servants from his wrath.
And behold that Sharaḥʿathat
and ʾAbīkarib have dedicated to their lord ʾĪlmuquhū
a statue fort he protection of their persons
and their livestock. By ʾĪlmuquhū and
their protective goddess.

… Saʿdum M.fikān and their sons ʾA-
bīkarib have dedicated to ʾĪlmuquhū, Lord of
the Ibexes of Ṣirwāḥ, a statue of bronze be-
cause he had granted him to be justified over Thawābtha-
wān bin Murādum, client of the lineage of
Dhū-Ḥubāb, against the accusation and the charge
which they i.e. the lineage of Dhū-Ḥubāb had levelled against his son
ʾAbīkarib, and against the charge that he had disengaged from his Thawābthawān‘s son ʿAbdʿath-
tar on the road with deceit?. And behold that ʾĪlmuquh had grant-
ed him i.e. the main dedicant of the inscription the restoration of legal right for ʾAbīkarib.
And behold that they expressed gratitude to the power and might of ʾĪ-
lmuquhū when he restored to his servants their legal right,
as he had vouchsafed to them in
his oracle that he secured the protection of
his son because he did not refrain from
importuning him with prayers and requests for oracles from him
regarding all his affairs that might be contested. And behold that
his lord ʾĪlmuquhū had promised him
the protection of his servants from his wrath.
And behold that Sharaḥʿathat
and ʾAbīkarib have dedicated to their lord ʾĪlmuquhū
a statue fort he protection of their persons
and their livestock. By ʾĪlmuquhū and
their protective goddess.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
